Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness and legitimate expectations
Governing_Law: Doctrine of legitimate expectations, principles of natural justice and procedural fairness
Application_Facts: Applicants sought cancellation of penalties and interest under fairness legislation; same officials involved in both levels of review
Decision_Outcome: Prior decisions set aside, applications referred for reconsideration by a different Director
Claimant_Status: Applicants denied relief due to lack of procedural independence
Defendant_Behavior: Respondents failed to follow their own published guidelines; reused original decision-makers in second review
Grounds_for_Claim: Lack of impartiality, breach of duty of fairness, violation of legitimate expectations
Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness, legitimate expectations, impartial decision-making
Assessment_Factor: Involvement of same officials in both review stages
Procedural_Issue: Lack of procedural independence in administrative review
Legal_Provision_Cited: Duty of fairness under natural justice, procedural fairness standards
Application_Basis: Legitimate expectation for independent second review
Evidence_Assessed: Existence and adherence to internal review procedures
Relief_Sought: Judicial review, setting aside of decisions, reconsideration by impartial director
Governing_Rule: Doctrine of legitimate expectations creates procedural rights requiring impartial review
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to demonstrate independence in review process
Outcome: Court granted judicial review, remanded for reconsideration
Harm_Assessment: Denial of fair review process leading to unjust penalties
Cause_Description: Applicants denied procedural fairness due to non-independent review
Evidence_Handling: Relied on procedural records and guidelines
Legal_Provision_Violated: Procedural fairness obligations under administrative law
Legal_Provision: Principles of natural justice, procedural fairness, fairness provisions in immigration legislation
Evidence_Assessment: Guidelines showed expectation of impartial review; evidence showed deviation
Decision_Rationale: Breached duty of fairness by not ensuring independent review as per established expectations
